description: From Ancient Greek ταξῐαρχος (taxiarkhos, “taxiarch”), from τάξις (táxis, “body of soldiers”) + ἀρχός (arkhós, “leader, commander”). Equivalent to taxi- +‎ -arch.

entries.meaning: (historical, Ancient Greece) An Athenian military officer commanding a certain division of an army.
examples: In recognition of his services in the education of the women of Athens, he was buried with the honors of a taxiarch, by special orders  […]
